jisa.devices

Interface TC

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Instrument, TMeter
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MSMOTC, MSTC
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ET2408, ITC503, LS336, VISATC

    public interface TC
extends TMeter
    Abstract class to define the standard functionality of temperature controllers

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  TC.PIDZone 
      static class  TC.Zoner 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default TMeter asThermometer() 
      default TC.PIDZone[] getAutoPIDZones()
      Returns an array of PIDZone object representing the zones used for auto PID control.
      double getDValue()
      Returns the derivative term co-efficient used for PID control
      double getGasFlow()
      Returns the gas flow in whatever units the controller uses
      double getHeaterPower()
      Returns the heater output power percentage.
      double getHeaterRange() 
      double getIValue()
      Returns the integral term co-efficient used for PID control
      double getPValue()
      Returns the proportional term co-efficient used for PID control
      double getTargetTemperature()
      Returns the target temperature set on the controller.
      double getTemperature()
      Returns the temperature measured by the controller.
      TC.Zoner getZoner() 
      boolean isFlowAuto()
      Returns whether the gas flow is currently controlled automatically or manually
      boolean isUsingAutoHeater()
      Returns whether the heater is currently operating automatically or manually
      default boolean isUsingAutoPID()
      Returns whether auto PID control is currently active or not.
      default void setAutoPIDZones(TC.PIDZone... zones)
      Sets the zones to use (ie the look-up table) for auto PID control.
      void setDValue(double value)
      Sets the derivative term co-efficient for PID control
      void setHeaterRange(double rangePCT) 
      void setIValue(double value)
      Sets the integral term co-efficient for PID control
      void setManualFlow(double outputPCT)
      Sets the gas flow to be controlled manually with the specified output
      void setManualHeater(double powerPCT)
      Sets the heater to be operated manually with the specified power output percentage
      void setPValue(double value)
      Sets the proportional term co-efficient for PID control
      void setTargetTemperature(double temperature)
      Sets the target temperature of the temperature controller.
      void setZoner(TC.Zoner zoner) 
      void useAutoFlow()
      Sets the gas flow to be controlled automatically
      void useAutoHeater()
      Sets the heater to be operated automatically
      default void useAutoPID(boolean auto)
      Sets whether the PID values are being automatically controlled using the look-up table defined with setAutoPIDZones().
      default void waitForStableTemperature(double temperature, double pctMargin, long time)
      Halts the current thread until the temperature has stabilised to the specified value within the given percentage margin for at least the given amount of time.

      • Methods inherited from interface jisa.devices.Instrument

      • waitForStableTemperature

        default void waitForStableTemperature(double temperature,
                                      double pctMargin,
                                      long time)
                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                      DeviceException,
                                      java.lang.InterruptedException
        Halts the current thread until the temperature has stabilised to the specified value within the given percentage margin for at least the given amount of time.
        Specified by:
        waitForStableTemperature in interface TMeter
        Parameters:
        temperature - Target temperature, in Kelvin
        pctMargin - Percentage margin
        time - Amount of time to be considered stable, in milliseconds
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Upon communications error
        DeviceException - Upon compatibility error
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Upon wait being interrupted
